The road ahead is a short one, and there are quite a few challenges ahead for the Helios team. The greatest being weather. All engineering feats aside, the greatest detriment to the success of this campaign is unfavorable weather conditions at our current launch site in Nashville, which is why we are asking you, the Kickstarter community, for help. 

We will know within 5 days what the weather in Nashville will be, and there are several logistical hurdles to relocating the launch to a new site, including but not limited to relocating a launch team of nearly 50 people to and from the alternative site, reserving hydrogen gas providers, reserving cranes, clearing launch sites in advance, transporting the vehicle and getting the proper permits from the city, county, state, and federal level.

We have to plan much of this in advance to create as many redundancies as possible to provide the best conditions for success and safety of the crew on board the Helios. We believe given the collective experience of the companies involved in the Helios mission, that we are especially equipped to handle the challenges that lie ahead of us.

The other contingencies to a successful involve being able to test the vehicle, unmanned, prior to launch which we anticipate first doing in March (strictly an electronics test) and then a complete unmanned flight test in late June, early July. The information provided to us during these unmanned flights will give us the data needed to recreate worst case scenario simulations that will better equip our flight crew in the case of emergency or equipment failure. We acknowledge the risks of this mission and have created as many precautionary measures to ensure the safety of both the flight and the crew.

Having a team of international engineers with extensive experience ranging from prior work with NASA or other major industry leaders, and by pursuing a simple vehicle model, our team is able to avoid many of the hurdles and delays often afford from more extensive endeavors. We have stripped away all non-essential luxuries to remove any liabilities that would delay, ground, or endanger the flight or it's crew.

Safety is our first priority.

The team behind the Helios has vast experience in near space and space exploration based projects. The most recent accomplishment by members of the Helios team was back in July of last year when when SATINS  helped launch and play a golden record into space setting a world record first.

Outside of the normal risks of starting a business, safety shoe manufacturing provides several risks that need to be addressed.

ASTM F2413-11: Although these shoes already meet the safety standards required in their country of origin, Mexico. We must ensure these shoes meet the rigorous safety standards in the US. This requires a series of tests to ensure customers are properly protected. The three of us have much experience in adhering to standards because our day jobs require us to do so. With creative engineering, adhering to safety standards and maintaining style can be achieved.

Inventory and Manufacturing: Low inventory helps keep costs down. Shoes are challenging in this aspect because several sizes (including half sizes for proper fit), colors and models must be kept in stock in the event of a customer order. Reduction of stock can be achieved through working closely with the manufacturer and analysis of customer orders. We plan to keep our inventory low through advanced order analysis and working with the manufacturer to synchronize our needs and their manufacturing flexibility.

Marketing: There are very few products similar to ours available in the US market today. We truly believe we have found a sizable niche market in the shoe industry. Our marketing strategy is simple. Begin selling by word of mouth. We all have exposure to many direct and indirect manufacturing connections. Approximately 4 months after our 1st official sale, we will use SEO to increase our online exposure (where we see a majority of our sales).  After approximately 8 months after our 1st sale, we plan to begin to attend trade shows. Our ultimate sales goal is to become a preferred suppliers of safety shoes to manufacturing plants, offering bulk discounts on our shoes after plant sells a predetermined quantity of shoes.

Shoes for Women: Our most common feedback we receive is "When are you going to make women's shoes?" We absolutely are passionate about developing stylish women's safety shoes. There are an enormous amount of women who work in industries where safety equipment is required. A quick internet search will reveal these women don't have much to choose from and we want to change that.

Potential production delays:

As our shoes are made by hand at a small-town workshop, there may be production delays, even with small-batch orders like ours. 

These may arise due to delays in procurement of leather or other components of the shoes or production bottlenecks. Our craftsmen are in high demand, thanks to their town's reputation for making great fitting shoes. That said, they remain committed to creating this capsule collection, and given their dedication to their craft, rest assured that your shoes are in good hands.

However, as everything is hand-made, imperfections do occur and that is why we are applying strict quality control and will individually inspect each and every finished product to ensure that you receive pristine-conditioned box-fresh sneakers

Hence, we appreciate your patience if a little extra time is needed to ensure that the final product arriving at your door-step is nothing short of perfect. The delay should be no more than 3-4 weeks, and we seek your understanding on this.

At Shokunin Shoes, we seek to make you and your family happy with stylish, sleek, and comfortable shoes you want to keep wearing.

Like all kickstarter projects, Pterofin anticipates a few obstacles along the way to revolutionizing the renewable wind and water energy industry.  Our team of engineers have been working on the design for the last three months and they expect it will take at least another three months until completion.  After the design is finished we'll need to perform Finite Element Analysis (FEA) and Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) simulations to determine the materials, fine tune the efficiency, and maximize the run time for each working model.  Finally we'll need to narrow down our list of suppliers and chose a manufacturer to produce and assemble our products, followed with finding a safe packaging and shipping method.  Since reliability is essential to our happy customers, the primary focus on what ultimately gets delivered will be on quality.  We anticipate the larger working models may take an additional six to nine months of testing, to guarantee your investment with Pterofin and in our planet, make a lasting impression.

Another challenge Pterofin faces is finding new team members, who not only share our same vision, but also posses the time and talent necessary to add value.  This is going to be critical to our success, especially if we are trying to reach millions of people without food or water.  We encourage everyone to visit our website to learn more about the current team to see where you can fit in!

Please don't hesitate to ask us a question by clicking the button below or visit our website at www.pterofin.com and thank you so much for your time!

Refunds:

-An order can be canceled and fully refunded before the end of the campaign by clicking on the applicable button on Kickstarter.

After the end of the campaign, the order can still be canceled within 15 days by sending us an email with your cancellation request. Please note that in this case the refund will not include the processing costs and Kickstarter fees, which will be deducted from your total. The development and industrialization of Equisense Motion showed us that creating a quality product from scratch is a long and complex process. The most important for us is to fulfill our promise to you, because you have put your trust in us. Building on our first experience, we also know that once the Kickstarter campaign is over, a number of challenges remain such as R&D, manufacturing, the certifications necessary in different countries, and logistics. We have worked a great deal to build our first prototypes and develop our algorithms. These first bodies have demonstrated that our technological core works. Moreover, we are now an experienced team with additional financial resources, and our industrial partners have extended their support for us.

We will ship the finished product and a first version of the mobile app in Summer 2017 (free monthly updates will then allow you to access all the features).
Our previous campaign enabled us to gain experience in the development of a technical product. This is why we prefer to give you a tentative date and take as many precautions as possible.

Our promise is that we will put all of our energy and our passion to overcome any challenge that we might come across as we have done with Equisense Motion. We would like you to bring us your ideas throughout this process. *Quedarnos cortos en la meta... (pensaríamos en vender uno de nuestros riñones)  =(  

*Que no logremos el tráfico de usuarios necesarios para generar suficientes eventos.

¡Para que esto no suceda, tenemos toda nuestra energía y tiempo dedicados en este proyecto!

Además de lo anterior, mediante las actividades patrocinadas daremos a conocer nuestro concepto para que creadores imaginativos como tú, puedan generar sus propios eventos.



* We stay short on the goal ... (we would think about selling one of our kidneys) = (

* We do not get traffic from users needed to generate enough events.

So that this does not happen, we have all our energy and time dedicated to this project!

In addition to the above, through the sponsored activities we will announce our concept so that imaginative creators like you, can generate their own events.

-Technology

Technology is a tricky thing. It can be so empowering but also hindering. Over the journey of creating STORY with our developer, we have learned some of the restraints that technology has. Well, at least with our current funds. Specifically, one of these challenges is building a back end application server that can handle high upload content. This means, that a user can not upload 245 pictures at a time because of server restraints. In order to combat this issue, we had to cap maximum single upload to 15 pictures and 1 video at a time. We do, however, allow people to update Memories right away and as many times as they want. In the future, with continued funding, we hope to build a more efficient server that can upload more pictures even quicker.

-Age

Since the team is 20 years old and under, we have sometimes had people not believe what we are doing and discount us because of our age. This originally prevented us from partnering with our first app developer. But you know what they say, "the early bird gets the worm" aka we are going to get the worm. 

-School & Work

Whenever each person joined the team, we have had to work around school schedules and work schedules in order for us to get work done. With four people, this was difficult. To say we have learned how to embrace Google Calendars and manage time would be an understatement.

-Knowledge

We get it, we're young. This has sometimes hurt us because, even though we don't like to admit it, we don't know everything. In order for us to successfully move through this project with excellence, we have had to embrace the saying, "It's not about what you know but who you know."

-The Future

One of the questions we get asked often is, "what if STORY doesn't work?" and to that we say, "we walk by faith and not by sight." One thing we have learned on this journey is that if you worry about the future, you'll miss the present. But if you are present and working, the future will take care of itself. So sure, it's a risk to launch a social media app but we firmly believe that we have a useful idea and a quality product. The bigger the risk, the greater the reward!

The risks and barriers we face have a lot to do with the usual things that small businesses need to overcome. Things like obtaining seed capital, budgeting operating expenses, reconciling overhead from this past summer, efficiency of domestic logistics, and keeping everything stable and recorded with regards to finances. 

But The Atinga Project faces unique obstacles also. Some of our bigger plans include developing the supply chain and Atinga team.  As mentioned previously, a baseline study is necessary for accountability and annual reporting. This is currently being tested and developed under pro-bono consultations.  

Without going into detail, teaming up with the artisan-shoemakers of Kigali to make sure our supply chain is efficient, with standardized varieties and sizes of atingas, is the task before us. This is also our biggest focus. We still have many more strides to make before perfecting a custom fitting system. We want to offer custom fitting to all customers, in person or online. We are thankful for the advice we continue to receive in this area of product development. These are some of the reasons why we have pushed back our delivery dates of rewards, so as to be as conservative as possible.  

Thank you for supporting Atinga throughout this journey in their shoes! We would not have gotten this far without you; and without you, we can go no further.

Everyone of you that have worked on a project or with business projects know that they take a lot of hard work, time and capital. We are a startup with few resources and that's why we have decided to go for crowdfunding campaign through Kickstarter.

We understand and we know that no project comes without risk and challenges. Despite our planning, there are circumstances that may be out of our control. If we encounter any of these, we promise to communicate with full transparency.

Everything is ready for production and we are expecting to deliver all shoes on time. We have a great relationship with our supplier and we personally supervise quality control.

MANUFACTURING COSTS: 

Manufacturing costs during these times can be extremely high and the quantity to order may be high as well. We look to the best manufacturers to provide the best quality and that can sometimes be pricey.  That is why we are fundraising to ensure we have the amount we need to manufacture good products. Our goal is to have more than one manufacturer with great quality materials to ensure that our products last. 

SHIPPING COSTS: 

Shipping costs, especially coming to and from different countries can be very high priced. Furthermore, we are also competing with big corporations for container costs and space. These prices get in the way of claiming product seats in shipping units. We are and will be doing our best to find the lowest shipping cost, so we can offer fair prices to our consumers.

DELAYED ORDERS: 

Delayed shipping happens, even more so during pandemic times. Sometimes during  the shipping process orders can be somewhat delayed due to transportation issues. We will give a window for when the order should be delivered and if your order has not been received within that period of time we ask that you contact us, so we can see how far the order is or if you want to request a refund. We will personally deal with the issue as transparency is important to us.

STOCK ISSUES:

Companies face stock issues all of the time. To help ease issues with lack of stock, we'll have pre-orders available for when stock runs out and send out emails when their orders have come in. We're also looking into having more than one manufacturer for our products so stocking issues rarely occur.  Lastly  will try to have extra stock on hand to cover stock shortages. Our goal is that we want you to receive the product in a decent amount of time. Keeping every customers happy is a priority.

There will no doubt be some surprises along the road, but any obstacle will be addressed by combining our internal knowledge with external expertise, and an overall goal of making the best possible product for you

Life as a touring and recording artist has never been easy, but with the advent of streaming and the loss of revenues from sales of CDs it has become more challenging than ever. Add in the current climate from the COVID-19 crisis and it becomes almost daunting.

Launching an all-or-nothing Kickstarter campaign is always a risk, but we believe that Kickstarter’s community of backers, the Ucross community, and all those interested in food, art, and place, as well as the High Plains and Intermountain West, will lift this project up and help us meet that $40,000 goal. Kickstarter activity and our ability to meet this goal will signal the interest in a Ucross cookbook, and whether there’s enough demand to justify a print run of 1,000 or 1,500. 

The immediate challenge is our ability to spread the word to interested parties inside and outside of the Ucross community. While we can reach many potential backers through social media, email newsletters, and word of mouth, we will rely on the Ucross community—alumni, friends, donors, partners—to share the link and point others to the project page. Can we build enough momentum to reach the goal and make this project viable? 

In the end, if Ucross doesn’t meet its $40,000 goal, we will re-evaluate the size of our print run, as well as our ability to absorb the costs without negatively impacting our general residency needs. That said, we have full faith that our community will rise to the occasion and help us launch The Ucross Cookbook by year’s end.

Kickstarter is an all-or-nothing model. If we don't meet the funding goal, this project won't be possible.

Risks:
Competition
At the moment there are no companies offering our services. This will most likely change, and we will keep ahead of the pack with 3D designers perfecting our models, material quality, and product choice development.
Technology:
Our platform relies on smart phones with specific modern cameras. All phones for the last 2 years have these cameras installed, so from that angle we are future proof.
We use development partners who we have signed supply agreements with, and we will constantly monitor, update and upgrade the application as new software and options become available.
Speed to market:
Fulfilment capability will increase gradually. Hardware is expensive and producing the models take time (a few hours to a full day). But we will be able to meet demand by staggering Kickstarter rewards and pricing. We will then precisely target and advertise through online channels and websites. If demand spikes we can adjust our delivery timelines by a week or so and scale up production.
Route to market will be through online marketing and referral programs.
Product management:
We will have a technician onsite 24 hours a day monitoring production so we meet targets.
Shipping:
Shipping large, fragile things can be costly. We will have a trusted and insured distribution and consignment partner.

Manufacturers of scare props in the UK is a very niche industry with few competitors outside the novelty arena populated by Bristol Novelty, Smiffys, eBay, Amazon and supermarkets.  Large theme parks now employ their own theming artists to produce props however, Victor Creative is focussed on smaller venues and home haunts who have little resources and would like an 'off the shelf' solution.
Locally, SIGA Creative FX, trading as Fear FX, is a competitor but they have recently made their staff redundant as they originally started as a manufacturer of scenery, sets and props for the likes of Butlins, Warner Leisure Breaks and Haven Holidays.  Dipping their toes into the scare industry, they grew too fast, neglected their 'bread and butter' customers, ignored individual customer requirements, concentrated on a handful of well known theme parks and consequently they 'peaked too soon' and burnt out.
Victor Creative plans to challenge UK manufacturers by being the 'the man in the middle', ie: not focussing on large theme parks nor providing novelties at the other end of the scale.  Victor Creative will fill a much needed gap in the market.
We will reboot this project soon!

(English) This is clearly a commercial and contractual challenge. In other words, it can be framed as a political operation: revitalizing distressed businesses, providing a model contract to riders, discouraging the purchase of books on Amazon. 

(Italiano) Si tratta chiaramente di una sfida commerciale e contrattuale. In altre parole, può essere inquadrata come un'operazione che ha del politico: rivitalizzare imprese in sofferenza, fornire un modello di contratto ai rider, scoraggiare l'acquisto di libri su Amazon. 

(Francese) Il s'agit clairement d'un défi commercial et contractuel. Autrement dit, elle peut être encadrée comme une opération politique : redynamiser des commerces en difficulté, proposer un contrat modèle aux usagers, décourager l'achat de livres sur Amazon. 

(Español  )Este es claramente un desafío comercial y contractual. En otras palabras, puede enmarcarse como una operación política: revitalizar negocios en dificultades, proporcionar un contrato modelo a los pasajeros, desalentar la compra de libros en Amazon. 

(Deutsch) Dies ist eindeutig eine kommerzielle und vertragliche Herausforderung. Mit anderen Worten, es kann als politische Operation bezeichnet werden: Revitalisierung von in Not geratenen Unternehmen, Bereitstellung eines Mustervertrags für Fahrgäste, Verhinderung des Kaufs von Büchern bei Amazon.

The world of audio drama has become more accessible and globally renowned than ever before, and this is amazing news for projects like Jötunn, as it makes them all the more appealing. It also means that the standard to which good audio drama needs to be produced is very high. We don’t want to merely have a few voices tell a story with a little bit of music in the background. We want to create an entire cinematic world you can dive into every time you press play. That requires professional talent, high-end tech and innovative effects, and that therefore raises the budget for each episode to £4k. 

Reaching our target will allow the creation of an amazing world steeped in Norse mythology, a genre that has found a place of high regard lately, but uniquely, you’ll be right in the centre of the drama. We have the team assembled whose credits have seen them in various high-profile projects already and they’re raring to go. We’re confident we can deliver something truly incredible.

The app development and game development industry is famous for its delays and unexpected occurrences. 

Despite our ambition, will, and confidence in delivering the final product in time, there is always room for uncertain events, and delays as different parties are involved in the process.

The nature of the app has a positive side. Once ready and published - everybody receives it in a matter of minutes! 

Of course, the more interest and funding MyChild’sLife will receive, the lesser the risks of delays. 

We will demo develop and test the app as much as we can. But it is still possible to find minor flaws and errors during the early access stage of the app. When we find such an error, or if someone reports it to us, we will go out of our way to make sure everything is running smoothly and updated correctly as fast as we can.

Next to that, all the gifts will be made by myself and a team of people with bigger and minor disabilities. This means the work can be a little slower, but it will be made with a lot of love. If we have to make a thousand packages, we might experience some difficulties delivering on time. But, we will try our best to deliver everything on time.

We are passionate about MyChild’sLife and all the memories it will gift to people around the world. Don’t just store pictures… Save memories!

Finding skilled production workers in my area will present no problem: I live in a rust-belt area that has many skilled but unemployed production people. I know I can staff my business, from laborers to techies, with no problem!

Our main challenge for this film is our time constraint. Our ambition makes it quite tricky to accomplish everything we want against the clock. In order to combat this challenge, quite a lot of work needs to be done in the pre-production stage so that during our shooting week and post-production stage we can be as efficient as possible. 

Another potential challenge is making sure that the two worlds that revolve around the main protagonist are portrayed in a manner which is understandable to the audience.  With the help of editing and the art department we can make sure that Brian's perception and reality merge seamlessly into one film.

Going into this project with all of the necessary equipment already at our disposal has really minimized our risk level. Even if the camera were to malfunction, we have back ups. This is an ultra low budget project so we are staying within our means to produce a fun film that is on par with the first movie.

Nobody wants to see a good idea and product executed poorly. We have worked extremely hard to get Kicks™ ready for Kickstarter, manufacturing and fulfillment. Everything in my head and on paper is planned out to the T however here are some unforeseen occurrences that might pop up-

KICKSTARTER/ BACKERS: I hear Kickstarter could take up to 3 weeks before releasing funds to our account. Also when the campaign is successful and we collect the shoe sizes and colors from our backers via Kickstarter and email some might not reply back! Some forget they have to let us know what they want. And in order to get an accurate order into our manufacturer we need as many people to respond ASAP. However we do have a deadline and we will move on regardless.

MANUFACTURING: We have never put in a large order with this manufacture before but we did do our homework on them and they can produce great shoes! They told us 60-90 days for manufacturing depending on how successful the campaign is and how much material/ shoes we make. We have great communication with them so if anything happens you will be the first to know.

CUSTOMS: Like any major shoe brand our manufacturing is overseas and with an order this huge it will be arriving by cargo/freight ship and going through US customs. We have all the paperwork and experts on this matter ready to go but things could get stalled if the U.S. Customs and Border Protection see any issues.

FULFILLMENT/ SHIPPING: Sometimes things go awry that can’t be planned for: a supplier misses a deadline, a machine breaks down, or a shipment gets lost. Those things could cause a delay. However we have great equipment, packaging, state of the art shipping label printers and software integrated with Fed-Ex or UPS. Domestic order in the USA should be fine. Internationals orders will take longer going back through customs to your country.

 Thank you for your help in funding our footwear startup! Please share this with anyone you know who loves shoes.

Est. Now

Risk/Challenges

App Review on Apple:
-Apple stores require dating apps to have limitations on how many swipes an account is able to use in a day. This prevents a spam quality to the app that will cause Apple to deny the app on their stores. Since its initial release in April 2021, the GeekELove team is working to create limitations in the swipe process. Our hope is to have this change implemented and the app available in September on Apple stores (app is currently available on android/google play stores). This date may be subject to change based on Apple's response to our changes.

Tiers with T-shirts
-T-shirt printing through our current supplier takes about two weeks to be fully printed and ready to ship. Please be mindful when picking your tier that t-shirts will be mailed out after the kickstarter has been closed. 

Speed Date Tier Benefit
-Currently we are building out relationships for locations for speed date outings. We will be starting with our state of MD first and its immediate surrounding area. Over time we are hoping to push out to more state locations in the East coast, and so on. This process requires building business relationships and it must be stated realistically as a small business this tier will have more options based on state locations.  We are open to taking recommendations as well from users in different states that know of great geeke locations that could benefit from this particular tier.

EN : 

This exhibition unites a new generation of contemporary artists and explores their different codes and languages.

Your support will contribute to the following three priorities and challenges:

To help the artists we would like to:
A. Produce new artworks during the residency at Les Moulins in August 2018.
B. Create new work in their studios and transport to site.

To share with you and the widest possible public:
A. Diffuse and communicate La Totale through a variety of media channels.
B. Create surprise events for you when you arrive.

For your comfort:
A. Facilitate a smooth and easy access to Les moulins by public transport.
B. Hire a navette that will bring you directly to and from Paris.

The project’s success depends on you!

Thank you from the team La Totale.


FR:

Cette exposition mobilise une nouvelle génération pour jouer sur différents codes du monde de l’art contemporain.

Nous avons distingué trois priorités, trois défis pour organiser au mieux cet événement :

1. Pour les artistes : votre soutien permettra aux artistes de produire sur le site des Moulins pendant une résidence de deux semaines en août. Notre volonté est de les soutenir dans leur recherche artistique et dans la production de leurs pièces. Pour les artistes non résidents, votre aide permettra de développer également la production de nouvelles oeuvres et nous permettra de les transporter sur le site de l’exposition.

2. Pour partager : votre collaboration nous aidera à diffuser notre projet, en utilisant tous les moyens actuels de communication avec quelques surprises festives en chemin.

3. Pour votre confort : votre contribution permettra de faciliter l’accès lors de notre exposition. Pour cela nous projetons d'organiser des liaisons en cars du centre de Paris aux Moulins, et également de la gare routière Coulommiers jusqu’au site.  

Nous réaliserons ce projet grâce à vous !

Merci de l'équipe La Totale.

There are 3 main risks and challenges associated with the project.

1. Lack of people using the application.  This application can only be successful if the masses of people use it.  It has an market base of nearly all 8 billion people in the world, a unicorn of its own.  However, if it does not gain popularity, it will be nothing.

2. Incitement of violence.  As images can spur the heart in any way, violence is a risk.  The fact that the users remain anonymous until they agree to exchange contact information is a safeguard (users cannot retaliate against the anonymous).  As the application grows, it is hoped that the department of defense and armed services in each country will be involved so that potential threats of violence can be curbed rapidly.

3. Legal issues.  This application surely is not legal in all countries.  Lawyers will have to be hired to determine what paperwork and documents need to be filed such that Ghost Writer Alpha remains compliant with the law.

4. Image stream does not present string of images that are meaningful or actionable.  This is a slight risk as users can still use the power to name the images...It is the thought that even if words are exchanged, it will lay the foundation for creating bridges across cultures.

- Wil & Bryan

As with all work near conflict zones there is some risk involved, however because of the specific group we are working with we are taking extra special precautions to protect our students from re-traumatizing activities. We want to help them focus on their goals and visions for the future rather than painful memories from the past.

These kids have already been through so much and we intend on helping them in every way we can to build on the best in themselves.

The staff who are participating have extensive history of working in conflict zones and many have been trained specifically for this kind of work. We will take every precaution to ensure they are safe and understand the risks involved in such a project.

A project of this scale has many risks and challenges. Bringing together aspects of construction, food service, and flames is not an easy thing on Playa. 

Fortunately, we are veteran burners who have brought countless theme camps, performances, art cars, and structures to Burning Man. We are aware of the challenges and pitfalls involved with anything on Playa.

Construction Challenges: We will be pre-building our structure in San Francisco two months prior to bringing it to the Playa.  The takeout box has been designed in a modular fashion to quickly bolt together on Playa.

Flame effects and burn safety: Members of our crew will take the Burning Man flame safety training course. Trained team members will be present during any open flame events. 

Food service and sanitation: We are applying for a State of Nevada health and food service permit prior to the event. Additionally our team will be cooking and serving mass quantities of dumplings at a small festival in July to hone our dumpling skills.

The biggest challenge for this art installation that this it's our very first installation at Burning Man. Since it's located in the Black Rock Desert, there are many challenges that we are going to have to overcome such as the harsh weather conditions or the fact that its location is very remote. However David attended Burning Man and is well involved in different camps that can give a little help if needed. But we're optimistic by saying that we won't need any help and we'll make sure to honour the principle of Radical Self-Reliance.
Other than that, Bertrand has a lot of experience with art installations. He already created and installed a working prototype of Aperture 11 in Paris, France, to see how it works and what are the possible challenges we may encounter. This will help reduce the technical issues in a significant way.

With this leap of faith comes the risk we won't hit the financial budgetary goals at the timeframes when funding is absolutely essential between now and the Burn. Each structure has it's own material purchase deadline and build schedule. Much of our fundraising exists in events. We're taking a step back this year to fully focus on collaboratively learning this new construction and skill alongside Rob and his team. We're looking to online crowdfunding, to you, our community, to step up to move us forward. Bringing large art into a sound camp is not a usual marriage. With it comes a completely different timeline and budget approach. Alongside all of this is our normal operating budget need. Basically, we are doubling our operating budget and that is no small feat for people with day jobs who come home and work another 3-8 hours each night. We do this for the joy of doing it, for those smiles at sunset at a party like no other. We depend on our community to lift the evolution bar alongside us.

The biggest risk I can anticipate is the public response to this project. While I haven't yet done a run of the performance outside of the relative safety of my college, I do plan on doing a run of the performance on either the June or July First Friday Artwalk. Outside of the context of the college I can most likely anticipate the participants being unsure of how to take the project and I expect a lot of questions about why I'm doing what I'm doing. I'm hoping that practicing on the First Fridays will help me to prepare for some of the questions. However, this piece is flexible and still developing and I am a student so I anticipate every experience performing the piece to be a opportunity to learn.

Problems I can run into are that I may not have the full amount of funding in time, the budget could be too low, problems with the music, equipment malfunctions, music video shoot location is not in order, weather, and many unforeseen actions.

 1) Finding the right company to tackle our design and give us a good quality product

This campaign, if successful, will fund the production of one print issue of the ERB and a full year of digital publication, paying writers, translators, local language editors, and illustrators. The risk for backers is low. There may be delays in delivering rewards, especially as the pandemic lingers, and in designing a robust and beautiful multilingual platform. And, of course, great essays are rarely written fast. But backers will receive what we promise.

The lifetime and eternal subscriptions mentioned in the upper reward tiers are, of course, aspirational. But in the longer term, we want to establish the ERB as an enduring institution: an independent platform and magazine sustained by subscriptions, both individual and institutional. Passing our initial crowdfunding target will further that larger goal, as will support from cultural foundations. In fact, success in this initial effort will help us garner support from those sources, as we demonstrate the power and necessity of an adventurous cultural magazine in Europe.

Any creative project has inherent risks and setbacks, but the creation of the Butterfly and Pollinator Garden Habitat and butterfly raising and release is a straightforward project, and we are seasoned professionals. The two things that could keep from delivering are acts of nature (floods, drought) and availability of Monarch Butterfly caterpillars. We have both those issues covered.
1.	Acts of Nature-Garden:  In the case we can not plant the garden this season we will move the planting date ahead by one year (2018) or until such time as we can plant successfully.
2.	Acts of Nature-Butterflies: We are being advised by conservation professionals in the process for raising the butterflies. If any act of nature or disease befalls our butterfly population we will raise and release as many as possible in the coming years at the sanctuary.  We will be raising the butterflies in multiple locations on the farm as to not lose the entire population if the worst happens to one group.
3.	Monarch Butterfly Caterpillars Availability: We will be acquiring Monarch Butterflies from one or more University cultivation programs. In the event enough stock is not available this year we will move the Monarch part of the project ahead by one year (2018) or until we are able to fulfill all sponsored butterflies.
4.	Butterfly Release Party and VIP Tea Party:  In the event of inclement weather we will reschedule the release at the earliest date that allows for a successful release and that would allow as many people to attend as possible.  We will broadcast the event with a LIVE STREAM for supporters regardless of their ability to attend or not.
5.	Rewards: Together with my wife and business partner Jennifer, we have over 56 years of combined experience in creating and implementing hundreds of creative projects for our commercial clients at Brickhouse Studios Inc, many much larger and more complex than the reward deliverables such as greeting cards, jars of honey, flower seed packets, fine art prints and the creation of garden benches. We have outlined the project so that it’s fully manageable with no major unknowns. There are always surprises, but we’ve built flex-time into our schedule so that we don’t promise more than we can deliver.
We’re professionals so we will stick with it even if the going gets rough. All-in-all, we are very confident that we can get all rewards into the hands of our supporters in a timely manner, and at a quality level that we ourselves would expect.
 
Thank you for your support! 
John and Jennifer Churchman

This is a passion project fueled by my need to create it.  The biggest risk I see that can affect the contributors would be a delay in production (e.g. due to conflict in cast and crew schedules).  Any physical perks (T-shirts, posters, storyboard panels) will be made and delivered on time. This includes the digital music download, which has already been created and is ready for delivery!

Delays can happen for a variety of reasons, including scheduling issues, location conflicts, and other personal reasons. This project, however, IS on a timeline and deadlines are expected to be met. Any consequence of unforeseen delays will be communicated to donators (e.g. delay in receiving physical perks as well as screenings and online live viewing sessions). All issues and conflicts will be resolved quickly in order to ensure the project's completion and donor satisfaction!

We have successfully run this convention three times before and have an experienced team in place. 

We have learnt many lessons from previous years and have already met the key technological challenges.

A potential issue is an inadequate venue and we have researched this meticulously, choosing a venue that has a good and solid track record and that has hosted conventions of this type. The venue is already reserved for us and we have access to the space over the entire weekend of the 2nd and 3rd September. An added bonus is that we used this venue for FantastiCon 2016 and as such have a great relationship with the staff already and an intimate knowledge of the technical capabilities of the venue.

Our major potential challenges are technological. This year’s convention aims to showcase at least one world first and as such faces the challenges that go with the transport and set up of complex equipment. We have an experienced and reliable core team in place as well as specialists in the specific technologies we are looking to showcase. Should the worst happen (via something catastrophic like a major cyber attack or power cut) we are confident that we can still deliver a superb event through backup contingencies and the expertise of our core team.

Despite our relatively small size we were voted top convention in 2015 because of the comprehensive and entertaining experience we provided. This in large part is down to the range of things we offer and meticulous planning. The diversity of our offering is itself a safeguard against comprehensive failure. 

With three successful years under our belt we are confident that this convention can deliver on its promises just as the previous ones have.

Our previous KS project concluded successfully although we lost a key partner in our most complicated and expensive pledge gift at a late stage which caused significant delays in distribution. We do not have any pledge rewards of this complexity for this project and all our pledge gifts are in place and ready to be shipped.

We do not require any approvals or pre-market reviews from any outside companies or agencies prior to distributing our rewards.

Learn Larp has run and fulfilled three successful Kickstarters, two for live-action role-playing and one for a printed book. This is a new type of project for us -- a printed game -- but we have the contacts in the board game industry for printing as well as options for domestic or overseas printing, depending on the number of games sold. 

GAME DESIGN AND PRINTING
The game itself is mostly finished! We've been playtesting it for six months, and incorporated a lot of excellent feedback. We've worked with some very experienced game designers to ensure that it plays well, and that the rules are clear and concise. The reason the time to fulfillment for this project is so short is because we are so far along in its development. 

Depending on the final number of printed games backed in the Kickstarter, we will decide whether to print the game domestically or overseas.

FULFILLMENT 
We'll also be using BackerKit for this project, which will streamline the shipping and fulfillment process, but is something we have not done before! Inevitably a few shipments will get lost or damaged, but we'll make sure backers get what they ordered!

TRANSPARENCY 
We're committed to keeping you informed throughout the process from pledge to fulfillment. If anything happens, we'll let you know right away and we will tell you how we're going to fix it.
Costs must be fronted due to the niche audience of the book and as a result crowd funding has been sought.

Making any movie is a challenge, but it is one we happily embrace. There are so many moving pieces on the production of a movie - weather, the cast, the crew, equipment rentals, expensive gear and cameras, weather, and did we say weather? - that any one thing could mean a delay, an extra expense, or a change of plans. On a project like this, our shooting schedule is lean and mean, and, like Millie, we will have backup plans for our backup plans. Though there are many risk factors, we are an experienced team who are determined to bring this dream to reality - and are prepared to be deft, flexible, and crafty with our budget in order to do so. 

Though we are currently seeking the best actors possible, we have not cast yet, and we want to find a Millie and an Emma who are perfect for the roles - and to play sisters! Because of this important element, a major challenge is scheduling. If the actors we want aren’t available at the same time, we may have to shift production to accommodate them. 

Another challenge is post-production. We want to be able to spend the proper amount of time to get this film feeling and looking just right. Editing and finishing takes a long time, but, to our advantage, our team already has a shorthand and a history of working together under pressure and stressful deadlines, and we are confident we can rise above this challenge.

In the world of filmmaking, there is always a chance that everything does not go according to plan. However, we have a very committed team that is dedicated to bringing the entire vision for this project to life, and we are confident that your support will help that happen.

We really want to thank you for all the support. Our production team has put so much effort into creating a film that we care so deeply about, but we would not be able to complete and share this project with the world without you.

If there are any delays, I can promise to communicate what is going on and keep you updated throughout the process.

Journey is an incredible game. The base rules were developed ten years ago and reliably create an intense experience for the players. With over 20,000 players all-time, Journey to the End of the Night is now one of the most successful street games in the world. It has been played in San Francisco, New York, London, Los Angeles, Berlin, Chicago, Venice, Washington DC, Vienna, and more. The core game has been tested over many years -- it’s so long-lasting and widespread because it is such a strong game. We are confident in that.

We know how to make this game happen. Our team has as a lot of experience: we’ve run over a dozen successful games of Journey to the End of the Night in DC, San Francisco, and other cities across the country. We’ve been helping run games since 2008, and we’ve been organizing the San Francisco game for the last three years. One of the original designers of Journey is on the team this year. We have done this before, so we know what needs to be done.

With 50+ volunteers already involved, even if a last-minute disaster were to take out one of our checkpoint leaders or staff chasers, we’d still be prepared with backups. We’re pretty confident in our staffing. Last year, 2000 players filled San Francisco streets for Journey to the End of the Night, and we were well staffed to take them on.

Weather is always a potential danger, even in San Francisco. If it rains, we will still hold the game -- we’re dedicated -- but it will be a much more challenging, sodden experience in which you might not want to play.

We really want to show that this game can be reliably funded and run, and this Kickstarter is our way of doing that. We’re committed to make a fun, free game for everyone that is also free of corporate sponsorship by using grassroots methods. We hope you’ll support us and be a part of making Journey happen this year.

H.E.L. kan de wetgeving omtrent airsoft apparaten niet voorspellen. Het gebruik van deze apparaten is sinds begin 2013 onder strikte voorwaarden gelegaliseerd. Dit is door de minister Teeven via een Koninklijk Besluit geregeld. Dat houdt in dat de overheid dit besluit in theorie kan terugdraaien. De kans dat dit gebeurt is klein, maar wel buiten de invloedssfeer van H.E.L. In het onfortuinlijke geval van afschaffing van de airsoft sport kiest H.E.L. altijd het meest vette en realistische platform dat binnen de regelgeving en wetten van Nederland toegestaan is. 

Kortom, de beleving is en blijft dan nog steeds het beste dat er is in Nederland en omstreken.

Daarnaast is H.E.L. afhankelijk van vergunningen van de gemeente. De gemeente is nu akkoord. Maar indien er nieuwe regelgeving komt, dan kan er vertraging ontstaan. Wij zijn altijd transparant over alles wat we doen. Mocht dit gebeuren dan hopen we op jullie begrip. Maar hoe dan ook, H.E.L. komt er!!

(English: the laws around airsoft are tricky. When laws change we need time to act on that. We hope you will understand this is not always in our hands or influence.)

Junior year is the first year in which the students get to spend an entire year on one project. At most, we would get a couple months to complete a project from beginning to end. Most of the projects were done within a few weeks, from writing the script to editing the entire project. Although these projects were not perfect, it was a great learning process. It was the best way for us to gain a lot of experience and to learn through our mistakes. Now, on a more realistic timetable for a much more ambitious project, I have to be able to adjust to such circumstances. I'm not used to such extensive planning and details, but it is something I've been excited doing so far in pre production. Organization is something I love doing, but I've never done it at this grand of a level. I just can't wait to see the payoff of this whole thing!

There is always going to be risks and challenges when it comes to shooting in the sea. Not only are we dependent on the surf and have to be spontaneous. But we also have to consider the dangers of being in the sea, such as riptides, waves, and the cold temperature of the English waters. This is why we are collaborating with experienced divers and a professional surfing photographer and will also work closely with lifeguards and the coast guard.
One obstacle we are still facing is finding an actress who can also surf. The part of the lead character Maya, requires someone who is physically fit, an experienced surfer, a good swimmer and also a good actress, who can portray the anxiety authentically. Naturally we have thought of a backup plan, which is to work with a stunt double instead.

The biggest hurdle that any musician has if he wants to be heard is being able to pay for recording time in a professional studio. Fortunately, we now have two studios that are equipped to do most of what we need. We have been recording and writing original music since the 80's. But, in the last few years technology has also allowed us to have a home studio that rivals pro studios! I've learned engineering and recording techniques from all of the engineers in studios that we've been in over the years and I have become a very good producer for music and videos with several projects already under my belt.   
    The second biggest hurdle is exposure. With the record business now in shambles and record labels being as rare as purple unicorns it is up to YOU! You are practically now your biggest fan! By joining the Kickstarter community we can be exposed globally as it is worldwide! We also have access to a local company to print CDs and DVDs.

In our years of doing Kickstarter campaigns, we have come across a few challenges and obstacles, and we always either overcome or communicate our way through them. 

There is always the chance of a pen or the wood you want will be backordered, but we are leaving enough time to likely overcome those obstacles. With my current lifestyle of traveling around the country, and using the back of my truck as a workshop, the weather can sometimes cause delays.

There have been times when a certain type of wood doesn't work for a type of pen, and in those cases we communicate with the backers to arrange a replacement.

With Covid-19, there are also occasions when shipping is delayed between the US and other countries especially.
Meeting our pledge goal will allow a run of alpacas to be produced, and meet all backer reward promises.

We’ve spent almost 3 years working on the Inner Mettle Earth Connect shoe, ensuring both the accuracy of our technology and the strength of our supply chain. The earthing technology has been achieved thanks to the hard work of our research and product design partners. The process from initial shoe concept to the final product is now complete. It involved numerous stages of research, prototyping and also user feedback. Since the Earth Connect shoe is a finished product, we don’t have any risks on the development side, it has been completed successfully. 

The greatest risk, or delay, to our project would be any disruption in our supply chain or logistics. We have mitigated risk by working with multiple manufacturing partners. If there was to be an issue we have a list of alternative partners available. Due to the unpredictability of the coronavirus pandemic, there is of course risk of manufacturing delays. If we are unable to fulfill all pledges by March 2022 we will offer refunds. 

Another risk that we could face is a higher than expected number of pledges for the Earth Connect Shoe, making it more difficult for our team to fulfill orders as planned. In such a scenario we will do our very best to increase production so that all orders will go out as scheduled. All of our materials are sourced from reliable and experienced suppliers. We don’t expect any delays but in the case of an unexpected event we promise to keep you updated. The production will only be impacted by 30-60 days in the case that we get higher than expected pledges.

Conceptualized in 2017, Jooray is sure to revolutionize the shoe industry, and we are thrilled to share it with the world. While there are always risks & challenges with creating and delivering a brand new product, we've minimized both by having the entire process, from production to delivery, already set and arranged.

We've partnered with key suppliers and manufacturers, and our prototype has been tested and finalized. We have the technical expertise when it comes to shoemaking and are using the best materials to bring you the best quality product and innovative technology.

All of this, along with our strategic partnerships with experienced crowdfunding and fulfilment experts leaves little room for error and ensures quick delivery.

1. Corona Virus: 

We're here to offer some assurances to our followers and backers. 

As we are not reliant on China (our shoes are made in Spain) at this time our supply chain is still operating and we have not experienced any indication of setbacks.

SNADD is our newest brand, but we have been creating beautiful leather shoes for over 25 years.

In that time, we have created strong supply and manufacturing networks and so all materials (suede, leather, sole etc) are all ready to go. 

As each shoe ordered will be made by hand in Spain, we are still on schedule to ship in August, should our campaign meet its minimum goal.

We will be updating everyone regularly on our production process, and any delays that may occur due to COVID-19 outbreak.

2. Fabrication: Since all of the shoes are handmade, each pair takes time to create. However we are confident that we will meet our August shipping goal. We have been in the shoe business for over 30 years and are confident in our suppliers and factory staff. 

3. Delivery: Your shoes will be shipped with tracked delivery, but on the rare event that your shoes are lost in the post, get in touch and we will work with you to get a replacement. If you are not home and miss the delivery, you will have to re-organise delivery with our shipping provider. 

4. Customs: There may be some custom controls that our out of our control, if you are outside of the EU, which may cause a slight delay to your delivery. We will be in touch with you all the way. 

5. Sizing & Exchanges: If you live outside of the EU, we unfortunately cannot offer you an exchange. Please make sure you are confident of your size before ordering.

If you are in the EU and wish to exchange, get in touch and we can get a new size shipped to you.

"Mr. Fennyman, allow me to explain about the theatre business. The natural condition is one of insurmountable obstacles on the road to imminent disaster."
"So what do we do?"
"Nothing. Strangely enough, it all turns out well."
"How?"
"I don't know. It's a mystery."
-- Shakespeare in Love

Replace "theater" with "film" and this immortal quote holds true.  As independent artists, we are constantly dealing with financial difficulties and logistical setbacks as we pursue our work. Having worked in the production offices and on sets of many bigger budget films, we know the "correct" processes for filmmaking; but having produced dozens of short films and music videos on a shoestring budget, we also know how to get work done despite the problems that inevitably arise.  

We have an amazing and enthusiastic team supporting us in this venture, and one of us is always able to offer a solution when the others feel stymied.  Many hands make light work!  Please join our team!

Where will the books come from?

We already have plenty of books ready for the library, and we will seek out high quality books of all genres and age ranges in used book stores, thrift shops, and yard sales. Hopefully Library patrons will donate a book or three when they visit. We won't be shy about asking for donations from bookstores or letting the Library's facebook followers know of our needs. My family is committed to acquiring and maintaining terrific and plentiful Library content.

What if someone objects?

First of all - who objects to a library??? Seriously, I can't think of a single reason to object to a Little Free Library.

Anyway, the LFL will be placed on our property. There are thousands and thousands of LFLs in the front yards of private homes. There are front yard LFLs in nearby communities like Oak Park and LaGrange, and they don't seem to bother anyone.

Little Free Libraries have been proven time and again to be of great community benefit, and a powerful tool to promote literacy. There's no downside! In the unlikely event of a problem, we will do everything we can to get permission to host the LFL. If, for any reason, we cannot host the Library on our property, we will work with the City to place it in a safe and convenient public place. 

Littlefreelibrary.org states that although objections to LFLs are extremely rare, they have, and will, contact government officials and do everything they can to help potential LFLs become realities. 

What if a local artisan or woodworker agrees to build the Library, but they don't follow through?

That might happen. We are not going to pay anyone for labor or materials in advance, so if a builder gets too behind schedule or must abandon the project, we will purchase a library from the Little Free Library Organization, most likely this one: http://littlefreelibrary.org/shop/library/amish-two-story-brownstone/

What if someone steals the books?

Well...the books are there to take. They can't really be stolen! In addition, anyone taking books in order to resell them will have a hard time. Library books will have a stamp or special bookplate on the inside front cover, and generally, used book stores will not buy a library book. People who abuse the honor system are either earning some bad karma for themselves, or have extreme need - either way, they have our pity.

Aren't you afraid of vandalism?

Yep. Hopefully, it won't happen. According to littlefreelibrary.org, incidents of vandalism are rare - communities that have Little Free Libraries are often very protective of them. Our front yard is well lighted all night and we may install additional solar lighting just for the Library. We have lived in Berwyn for 12 years now, and our home has never been vandalized except for spray paint ugliness on the garage once, and some flowers picked from the garden. If the Library is damaged or destroyed, we WILL rebuild it....bigger, better, stronger. 

The best way to stop vandalism (and ignorance, and apathy, and many other things) is to drown it in books!

Shoe making is a complicated business.  I once worked for the former CFO of a major airline, and I remember him telling me that it takes longer to make a pair of shoes than an airplane.  

But I understand this industry inside and out – and better than most people.  I've also assembled a best-in-class team to help me deliver your shoes on time and hopefully just the way you remember.  Collectively we have deep and broad experience covering the entire supply chain and the connections with retailers who are excited to bring you your beloved Famolare shoes again. 

MANUFACTURING: The biggest issue new shoe companies face when it comes to delivering product is meeting their factory’s MOQ’s (minimum order quantity).  We’re hoping that we will meet our MOQ’s just with our Kickstarter orders and can begin production within 90 days rather than 180.  Though we have the moulds, and know they work with the machines where we plan to produce the bottoms for samples and production, we still need to confirm that the lasts will work with our factory’s equipment.  If they don’t, we will need to open new lasts, which may add a couple of weeks to the production time.  We also need to go through fit trials, and then order the dies used to cut the leather uppers for each style. 

FULFILLMENT: Sometimes things go awry that can’t be planned for: a supplier misses a deadline, a machine breaks down, or a shipment gets lost.  Those things could cause a delay.  We will be working with manufacturers and component suppliers who have years of experience delivering excellent products.  There will no doubt be some surprises along the road, but any obstacle will be addressed by combining our knowledge, expertise, and connections with an overall goal of delivering your Famolare shoes on time.  

Any pledge amount brings us one step closer to our goal of bringing you the most comfortable and coolest shoes you’ve ever worn.  You can make it happen by clicking the ‘Back This Project’ button at the top of the page, and by helping us spread the word by sharing our page with your friends and family.  Thank you for contributing your efforts toward Putting America Back on Its Feet.

Of course, unexpected challenges commonly occur. For this reason we continue to stay in good communication with our manufacturers and team to assure we do everything we can to prevent unwanted errors. Our suppliers are very capable of large orders. What challenges might we face and how will we overcome them?

Gold Star is an extremely low budget film and with a low budget comes a fast-paced set and a quick shooting schedule. We are shooting this film in September, and with this Kickstarter look to secure the last possible funds to ensure production can go ahead.  

We are prepared for the constraints of low budget filmmaking, and believe that the intense preproduction process and planning we are in the midst of will serve for a smooth shoot. Problems do arise, but we are a strong team and think quickly on our feet. 

Shooting home in Connecticut, where Victoria grew up, has already proven extremely beneficial as Victoria's hometown and community have come together to ensure that Gold Star is completed and supported.

Our principal concern is logistics: housing the crew for three weeks, coordinating the schedules of the talent, and completing the film within our time-frame will be challenging. But, this is the nature of filmmaking, and we are very excited to execute a wonderful product.

The score will be composed and recorded during the months of Fall 2014. The Pitt-Greensburg Chorale and Chamber Singers will be recorded during and after their Fall concert.

We are looking to release Crown of Gamma in Spring of 2015.

Since the movie is already shot and edited, this campaign poses a lot less risk than a completely unmade film.  But we are venturing into unknown territory with the effects; the technology we're depicting is a few years away, so we're taking some bold steps in imagining what Augmented Reality will be like.

Once we raise this last piece of money, we'll start actually realizing these ideas with animation and design.   Even with all of our preparation, there is an aspect of discovery here as we try out different approaches to integrating the AR interface, and figure out what works and what doesn't, both visually and narratively.     Our hope is that we may even come up with some stuff that may inspire actual AR development!

We have completed and finalized our prototypes, and have the factory and personnel in-place to produce the Wayfarer from start to finish. We have several retail distribution outlets that have expressed a keen desire to sell our Wayfarer line. That being said, we see some risks and challenges with regards to logistics, production, and distribution:

Logistics 
Due to the range in sizes and colors required by our customers our initial inventory may not match demand. We intend to address this issue by gauging customer interest and needs and adjusting our product offerings appropriately.

Production 
There may be some minor adjustments in manufacturing to improve the final product. These will always be for the benefit of you, the Ventani customer, and we will let you know exactly why and how any are made.

Distribution 
Due to international shipping costs and customs restraints we are unfortunately only able to sell and distribute our shoes to customers in the United States and European Union. 

There will no doubt be some obstacles and surprises along the way, but all issues will be promptly addressed by combining our own internal knowledge and experience with external expertise. With the over-all goal of bringing to you the best possible crossover shoe, to have you looking good and staying cool!

We are aware that with the high street there comes certain challenges:
 - Hiring: in the near future after the shop opens we will have to create a team of individuals to share our vision and help keep the shop open as often as possible.
 - Security: unlike the usually tight-knit communities of LARP events or conventions we will have to make sure that we are aware of the perishable aspect of our stock and take precautions.
 - Perception: though LARP and the geek world in general is becoming more mainstream, we must work hard to create a professional front that moves away from certain unfortunate stereotypes. 
 - Shop availability: though it is unlikely as the high street is unfortunately consistently full of a smattering of shops to rent; as we intend to make sure that the space we use is as close to perfect as possible, it could take some time to open. However, we are dedicated to finding the right space and already have several in mind.

We have identified three main challenges:

Buyer Awareness
Getting the word out about our brand isn’t easy, but we’re gearing up the social media machine and have reached out to industry review companies such as The Toy Insider. We consult sales and marketing specialists when necessary and have done a great deal of research about affinity marketing, sales funnels, and more. We understand the need to strongly integrate these concepts into our business as a necessary part of success.

Part Acquisition
Working with overseas manufacturers for parts is difficult. It can impact timeline and quality, and we’ve been working on improved sale forecasts and better communication with our vendors to stay on schedule and to keep costs tight.

Shipping Cost
It’s not cheap to ship Spider Disc Games or UberDarts. With an increase in shipping volume, we will be able to negotiate more reasonable volume shipping costs with UPS, FedEx, or USPS.

Some difficulties could arise due to working in a community that does not have previous experience with shoe making.  However, in order to maximize our success we have decided to approach job creation through a 2 phase process.  

Phase 1 will be utilizing the expertise and experience of an established shoe factory in San Pedro Sula, Honduras.  With the help of our "sister" shoe factory, which Jamie has visited 3 times and who made our prototypes, we will begin manufacturing with experienced artisans.  A handful of people from Roatan will join the artisans in San Pedro Sula and begin a 4-5 month formal training process.  Once they are thoroughly trained and are confident and capable of executing every task needed to produce a high quality sandal they will return to the island of Roatan.

Phase 2 will begin when our well trained locals return from San Pedro Sula at which time they will begin training others while producing minimal orders.  Slowly we will move the sandal orders from the established factory in San Pedro Sula to the new factory in Roatan.  Within 1-2 years we will be manufacturing 100% of the footwear on the island of Roatan with "new" but well trained artisans.

As with any business, there are risks for Back 9. The bar and restaurant industry is known to be highly risky, with many independent establishments closing within their first year of business. How can we avoid this failure? Learning the most likely causes and taking steps to prevent them. While there are many details that come together to create overall success, below are some of the biggest issues bars and restaurants face and how we plan on avoiding or mitigating them.

First, how many of these businesses actually fail? In 2005, researchers from Cornell University, home to one of the most well-respected hospitality programs in the country, proved that the "90% failure rate in the first year" for restaurants cannot be accurate. Using statistical modeling and based on the 3-4% growth rate in the industry, they concluded that a 30% failure rate is more likely in the first year. This is good news for us, because statistically, we're already moving in the right direction! (http://pitchforksoptional.com/wp-content/uploads/2011/12/restaurantsfail.pdf)

The same study from Cornell, along with a few other resources, have listed being undercapitalized as a huge problem for bars and restaurants because they are unable to handle unexpected costs and delays. (http://www.nightclub.com/operations/reasons-why-bars-fail) 
To mitigate this issue, we have built many financial cushions into our projections. We need your help to finance our startup costs, so that we can be a stable business with the resources to overcome obstacles.

While proximity to competitors can help bring in customers, the inability to differentiate from those competitors can put a business under. (http://www.growthink.com/businessplan/help-center/how-to-open-a-bar) We addressed this issue by clearly differentiating Back 9 from local establishments with the self-serve tap system and the fun competition of mini golf made with adults in mind. Back 9 is unlike any other bar, mini golf, or entertainment venue in the city, and it will become a destination for locals in our target market.

Another hurdle is including the right people with the right knowledge areas to support your business. I'll never pretend to know everything about opening a bar or mini golf course, but I have brought in people who do to help me. I've included two business advisors, a bar owner, a restaurant supply expert, an architect, a broker, and a sports league manager on my team to help me make this business operate smoothly and become profitable.

Finally, we'll spend resources on the things that help provide a memorable guest experience, like quality products, a well-maintained facility, and exceptional customer service from properly trained staff. (https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/top-10-reasons-bar-restaurant-failure-5-solutions-tim-borden) This will create a solid base of return customers who will help generate more business through their use of social media, online reviews, and word of mouth.

When it comes down to it, though, there's no way to guarantee success. I wonder: Will people show up? Will they like it? Will they come back? I've prepared and researched as much as possible, and I'm confident that this business will become a premier nightlife spot in Pittsburgh and maybe even expand to other cities.

Our biggest challenge to completing this project is raising the funds necessary. Our script is complete and polished, our cast is talented and prepared, and our crew is experienced and adaptable. However, that doesn't preclude us from the natural logistical volatility of filmmaking. As any filmmaker knows all too well, Murphy's Law tends to rear its ugly head at the worst of times. Filmmaking is about problem solving, pure and simple. It's having the work ethic to craft a perfect plan but also the experience and resolve to adapt once your plan inevitably blows up in your face. It's about putting the time in, asking questions, and learning from your mistakes. Our team has done that.

We understand the challenges we face to get this film made, but we are resolute in our efforts. Making art always involves risk. That's the fun of it. You can pitch your movie to one guy who decides if it will get made or to thousands of backers online. Both cases involve you letting go of your work. We understand that filmmaking is a collaborative, expensive medium and many things have to come together to get a project like this off the ground. 

To put it simply, we are in your hands now, but there's nowhere else we'd rather be.

One of the biggest challenges facing MISS INDIA AMERICA is the utilization of our social media campaign to bring a wide and diverse audience to the project.  With your support of our Kickstarter campaign, we are not only raising money, but also raising awareness of the project, and building fun new ways to engage with the story beyond the film.  We want you to be a part of this as much we are, but we can only do it with your help.  Distributors and exhibitors look to see if a project has support beyond the filmmakers, and one of the metrics used is how much of the social media is being engaged around the film.  If our social media campaign does not catch fire, we are still going to make an amazing film and get it out there through more traditional channels.  We have a team in place that has swam those waters before and can do it again. However, we hope to utilize new tools and methods to get the message about the film out there, and we plan on making this story as fun outside of the film, as it is inside of the film.

One common risk for app developers is pending approval from the Apple and Google Play Store. Our app could be rejected if testing doesn't completely cover any flaws in the application on multiple devices. We would assess the risk by thorough testing, and in the case it is rejected, we would resolve any issues and re-deploy the application to the app stores for approval.

Another common risk is a delay in development. An issue or bug may arise that could set the development team back by 1-3 days. An extreme delay such as 3 days isn't common. Sometimes bugs arise from external issues; however, the development process usually balances itself because another set of tasks may take less time than estimated.

There are several potential risks typically associated with a project like this, but we’ve done everything we could possibly do to mitigate them! 

First, restaurants can be risky enterprises. However, The Lucky Well is already a successful and proven concept that has been in operation and delivering consistent quality since 2013. Instead of launching a new restaurant, The Lucky Well Commissary is an extension of a successful concept.

Chef Chad Rosenthal also has a strong, established personal brand, a large social media following, and a passion for converting customers into loyal brand partners. 

The other potential risk is the challenge of working with low-income and homeless populations. While The Lucky Well team is familiar with launching and operating successful restaurants, they've not worked with a high-risk population in this capacity previously. In order to ensure success of this model, they’ll be leveraging strategic partnerships with local shelters, service organizations and community leaders who will serve as advisors by providing guidance and expertise throughout the planning, development, and launch of this concept. 

Strategic partners will advise The Lucky Well on the best outreach, hiring, training and retention models, common challenges and barriers to opportunities, and crisis communication training. These partnerships are essential to ensuring a positive, supportive and effective employment experience.

Why are we destined for success against all odds?

To date CRAVE Magazine has been an out-of-pocket venture on behalf of our publisher. Our growing online presence is the product of countless unpaid hours on behalf of our editor. Together, this entrepreneurial duo has more than 20 years of combined experience in the creative industries.

All of the content that has been produced thus far in print and online has been thanks not only to our managing team, but in greater part thanks to a collaborative effort on behalf of our community. Countless artists, writers, photographers, graphic designers, legal consultants, local businesses, community leaders, state representatives and general art enthusiasts have jumped on board and contributed their efforts and support to help make CRAVE Magazine what it is today.

In short, we've already laid the groundwork and CRAVE is finally gaining momentum at a fever-pitch. So when it comes to producing our next issue, it should go without saying that we've researched our printing costs and shipping costs, and we know how much work it takes on the creative end and we know how to make this a successful endeavor.

In this way, our greatest challenges and risks are not necessarily in the details of how we will fulfill our Kickstarter promise but more so in how we will continue to grow and share CRAVE Magazine as a whole in the distant future. 

Ultimately CRAVE is much more than just a print publication or an online presence. We are more than sum of our parts. We're here now because we know where we stand, we know what we need to do to move forward and we know that with the help from the greater art community, we can get there.
