As our first international project it is a challenge to engage with a broader audience and hope Kickstarter will help us achieve this. We want to bring together as many individuals and organizations to the problem of construction in the tropical forests of the world.

Our major risk is that the communities would feel threatened by us, as foreigners. To avoid this possible reaction, we have formed alliances with local NGOs and institutions that will guide our visits. In Cameroon we are working with the NGO CADAC, in Honduras with Mopawi and in Indonesia we are working with Architecture Sans Frontières to define a collaboration work with the Parahyangan Catholic University.

We know this project is ambitious but believe this documentation and research is necessary for future development projects around these sites. We are proud to be organizing this work from Peru, a developing country that is currently facing very harsh problems in terms of preserving our forests. 

The timeline for the documentary film is one year of production with a film crew composed of six professionals working as volunteers. We hope to be completing all the edition of the film on time but if any setbacks do arise, we plan to keep you informed. 

//Este es nuestro primer proyecto internacional, y esperamos que la plataforma de Kickstarter nos ayude a llegar a un público más global. Creemos que sólo habrán soluciones o propuestas frente a este problema si involucramos al mayor número de personas y organizaciones mundiales posibles.

Nuestro principal riesgo es que las comunidades que visitaremos se sientan amenazadas ante nuestra presencia como extranjeros. Para evitar esta posible reacción, hemos formado alianzas con ONG locales e instituciones que guiarán nuestras visitas. En Camerún estamos trabajando con la ONG CADAC, en Honduras con Mopawi y en Indonesia estamos trabajando con Architecture Sans Frontières para definir un trabajo de colaboración con la Universidad Católica de Parahyangan.

Sabemos que este proyecto es ambicioso, pero creemos que esta documentación e investigación es necesaria para futuros proyectos de desarrollo en estas áreas. Estamos orgullosos de estar organizando este trabajo desde Perú, un país en vías de desarrollo que actualmente enfrenta problemas graves frente a la depredación de nuestras selvas.

El cronograma del documental es un año de producción con un equipo de filmación compuesto por seis profesionales que trabajan como voluntarios. Esperamos estar completando toda la edición de la película a tiempo para septiembre del 2018, pero si surge algún contratiempo, planeamos mantener informados a todos los patrocinadores.

We are a dedicated team and we believe in making our venture a success. As you can see already, we have taken the first step toward completing this food truck project. However, we are anticipating many unforeseen obstacles to be tackled. 

After conducting extensive research based on our financial analysis, some challenges arise with the opening of our business:


Location Changes – Rate of Risk, 20%
The food truck program is relatively young in Boston. While the city is working hard to help food trucks to secure vending locations, there are always potential risk factors such as weather, public events, and street maintenance. We will make sure to notify our customers of any potential changes to our locations ahead of time.

Truck Breakdown – Rate of Risk, 15%
Our truck does have some mileage on it. There could be possible downtimes if there are minor mechanical problems. We will be working with the most efficient mechanics to ensure that we are at the designated spots.

Competition – Rate of Risk, Low
We will anticipate competition. However, we believe that friendly competition is going to elevate the food truck scene. We hope to generate a following with our sense of promoting authentic and healthy food.

The initial challenge out of the gate will be the notorious Boone winters, which are traditionally a hard experience for most local businesses. Our intention is to conduct a strong marketing initiative to counter this phenomena. We will put out ads in local-regional newspapers, magazines, and other form of media, as well as conduct interviews and gain coverage in journalistic expose's. Vitality will use internet and smartphone social media tools, and will work to develop new means for doing business in a tech savvy world.

Wenn das Budget nicht zustande kommen sollte, versuche ich selbst den Betrag zusammenzubekommen.  Ansonsten bestehen keine weiteren Risiken, sodass nach erfolgreicher Vollendung der Kampagne jeder seine zugeschriebene Entlohnung erhält.

This project poses very few risks to our supporters. For nearly five years we have proven ourselves by producing high quality content that makes an impact. Now, funding will allow us to continue and expand our efforts.

We have the infrastructure and the skills. We've never before had funding to create a sustainable site, which is essential in order for us to continue to operate in the future.

The primary risk we have is missing deadlines due to our instructors having to work day jobs. To mitigate this risk, we have a ringleader in Dave Stanton who will focus on this project every day. Dave will be running the Twitter account and posting public updates. 

We hope to have all of the courses launched in August. If we have delays, we'll ensure that the courses with the most reservations are completed first. Backers will have the option to change their course reservation(s) in the event of any delays. However, we're intensely committed to getting everything completed on schedule in order to reach as many people as possible for the fall academic term.

There aren't any risks to supporters of the magazine. However, the workload is heavy for my small team. There are many roles that are carried out and having financial support will ease that by allowing the expansion of the editorial team.

Det gäller för alla Kickstarterprojekt; uppnås inte den begärda summan blir inte projektet av. (Dina utlovade kronor dras då EJ från ditt kort.)

From the moment I actually started this project, I have been met with challenges on a different level I've never experienced before. One significant challenge has been securing the funds to infer as a downpayment. Learning what I've been told from lenders as to what they expect to already be available in cash coming from me was a bit overwhelming at first; I happen to be a single, child-less Black Woman working in a male dominated industry that normally pays a little above minimum wage, and I also completely support myself without any outside assistance. On top of that, it seems that asking for monetary support from others is especially hard right now, due to the most recent global events of the past 3-4 years. I want people to believe in me and my product. I want people to know that whatever I receive from them as a donation and pledge will not just be received with the utmost gratitude, but that it will pay off for them as an investment long into the future. I offer the rewards that I do as proof of my confidence in my product, but more than physical compensation for pledges, I want people to know that my Food Truck represents more than just making money selling Sliders just to pay bills. It represents a dream of a future where I have the ability to give back to my family, friends, and community in ways I have never had the power to do before. It represents being able to make someone else's dreams come true, just like I am attempting to do. It represents what true hard work against all the odds can accomplish. That is why your support will be reciprocated with all of my love from the bottom of my heart and connect you to a dream that is meant for all to benefit from.

The creative work of gathering and editing recipes and designing the book has been completed! The greatest challenge of this project is the possibility for supply chain disruption that would lead to a delay in receiving books and fulfilling orders. We’ve mitigated this risk by using a reputable printer in the United States, with whom we worked successfully on the first volume. Though it increases the cost per unit for the books, their domestic location shortens the distance of delivery, reducing the possibility of disruption and speeding order fulfillment.

Honestly, at this point we've produced three, highly respected films about cryptids. There isn't much of a risk when it comes to backing Small Town Monsters. However, there are multiple challenges we'll face during production of both of these films. This is the first time ever we plan on fully producing two films in one year. There's no doubt we'll face numerous obstacles along the way, but with your support we'll be able to take both of these films to the finish line by October.

We can't thank you all enough for continuing to support each of our films. As long as you continue backing them, we'll continue making them!

For all intents and purposes the film is complete, so really, THIS is the biggest challenge - raising the funds we need, and putting those funds to good use. The price of color correction, sound mixing, and archival licensing fees all add up quickly. Plus - getting the film out into the world is a whole other part of the process. Film festival submissions, as well as marketing and promoting a film, can be remarkably time-consuming and costly. So finding a home and audience for this documentary is inherently a challenge. 

Your contributions will not only allow us to complete the film, but you will also help us gain and grow an audience in the process. After months of production and post-production work, we’re extremely proud of the film and think it has great potential in the festival circuit. In short - your contributions help us improve the quality of the film, and enable us to get it out into the world. We've been working on this thing for nearly two years, and we can't wait for you all to see it.

The biggest risk is that no-one will hear about this project and it'll go nowhere. However, with a dedicated community of official supporters on board, the framework's already there for this to make a good impact.
Furthermore, some of the funds from this campaign will go into hiring a social media / press officer to help us get the word out there even more effectively.

Filmmaking comes with its own unique risks, challenges, and set-backs. I have been working on this project for almost two years now. I originally wanted to release it in 2016, but I was unable to secure the necessary funds or dedicate enough time to complete it for a 2016 premiere. 

Despite obstacles, I have continued to work on this film and am so happy to reach these final stages. Equipped with a small grant from the Regional Arts and Culture Council, I am able to push toward the completion and am confident in the timeline I have created for 2017. 

While aspects may change, I am dedicated to completing this project this year. I am also required by my RACC grant to finish this project within 2017, which makes me accountable outside of my own desire to complete this film. 

My composer, Andrew Klein, has been hard at work creating a score. The only pieces left are the sound design, color, and then final premiere (and all the marketing that comes with building an audience for that premiere). 

My plan is to premiere the project in May - and if unknown obstacles arise, than this premiere date may get pushed into the summertime. That is the largest change that I can foresee to this film and I will keep everyone updates on the progress both through kickstarter and the film's facebook page.

Folks, the book is written and in final stages of editing.  We have a reputable Australian based printing house and once editing is complete we are ready to go.

The major risk is shipping.  Australia Post is our national mailing service and as much as we love Aussie Post... well COVID-19 has put somewhat of a dampener on delivery times.  We have set the delivery date as May 2022 with this in mind.

This is my first book, and thus it is entirely possible there will be unforeseen difficulties. Additionally, supply chain issues are everywhere right now. No matter what happens, I will communicate with all backers if the timeline needs to be adjusted.

While $10,000 is our goal, we'd love to earn more, especially since inflation is looming last and prices are still getting higher for equipment. So, at this point, budgeting is approximate, but could get higher.

Producing this book is a BHAG (Big Hairy Audacious Goal). I believe it can happen. The ideas have been kicking around in my head for more than a year, and each experience I have seems to point toward making it a reality. Because I will produce all pieces of this project, and because I haven’t previously had time to devote to this large task, my goal for completion is the end of 2022. I plan to spend the bulk of my time designing, photographing, writing, and editing this book. To achieve my goal of getting high quality photos of EVERY PLANT in a range of aspects, I plan on having a dedicated day in the field each week for photography, after which I will organize shots into folders by plant, allowing for a library to build up throughout the seasons. 

I have created this challenge for myself because I truly believe this book is needed. As a supporter, you will be helping to provide the time and space for me to meet this challenge. Part of the fun for my supporters will be getting updates along the way, and witnessing the evolution of the book. Let’s get after it together!
The biggest challenge we might face is hiring ... from writers and editors to videographers and advertising managers.

This is my second crowd funding campaign, and I have calculated ample time to order the decks and then send them out, I will keep you update on the process throughout, and of course everybody will be notified if there should be any delays.

The print shop is definitely found and the offer stands. This printing company provides a high-quality offset printing (like my two artbooks before). I thought my project seriously and do not see any risks.

Having a production always involves a risk. But I've tried minimizing the risks by setting the max capacity on 400 decks - to secure, that I can handle the production, ensure a high quality and deliver as scheduled.

Updated: We secured a local printer who expects to have the first shipment of books for early bird backers by the first week of December. Remaining book rewards are expected to ship later in December. This will be ahead of schedule which is a relief. 

We noticed a trend in fulfillment to overseas backers around fulfillment and tariffs. To minimize risk factors, at the moment we will only ship to North America, Canada, and Mexico.

We are looking into options for shipping the physical book to more countries. Updates will be posted soon. In the meantime a digital option is available.

Shipping has been a challenge since Covid. To protect the books and rewards we are taking extra packing protocols.

Since the book is already done and the suppliers / collaborators are secured, I don't foresee a lot of risks for this project to be completed within the stated budget and timeline. The biggest risk will be delays with the typesetting process as well as delays with the printing / shipping during the holiday season. However, I am planning on shipping after Christmas anyways in order to avoid the congestion. If we end up being ready to ship before Christmas, I will update backers and proceed with the best course of action in light of holidays and shipping.

While the written book is finished, publishing a book can be a lengthy process with many potential snags. Printing and shipping issues may delay receipt of the paperback and hardback copies, and formatting issues may delay receipt of ebook copies.

Audiobook recording is a long process that must be done to rigorous specifications. It will take a long time for me to record and edit it, and even then it has to go through a testing process to make sure it sounds consistently good throughout. There may be snags along the way that I'm not aware of, so it may take even longer than I anticipate to get the audiobook done.

I'll keep everyone posted on production and any potential hiccups that might come up. But, in the end, at least the book is finished!

My only real concern is the timeline, getting the book printed and out to you asap. I would like to get it to you before the end of the year, but it all depends on how long the printer takes. So I've estimated that I will have it to you be February 2022. 

As I write this the book is finished, I'm editing and finalizing the text and layout. So once this campaign is complete it will be ready to go to print. Any delays there after I will keep you updated on.

The path to finishing this documentary and distribution on American public television is clear. My previous successful Kickstarter campaign has only funded a fraction of the overall cost, and I've made up the difference out of my own pocket. Thanks for your support, monetary or otherwise!
No risks, the book's complete!

The results of all survey research are subject to "sampling variation" which means that the results should not be treated as exact. This applies to both the private surveys I intend to execute and the surveys run by government agencies that form official statistics. A consequence of this is that the data released from this project will not be an exact predictor of the data with which it correlates. There will always be some level of "tracking error" which is essentially random month-by-month. In addition, the project is contingent on third party services which may change in price or availability and if such changes make this project economically unviable it will be terminated without the return of used funds.
There are inherent risks when printing anything but I'm confident in the shop I've chosen to do the printing.  They have a great track record of making nice books in a timely fashion.

The biggest risk is the amount of time it will take to produce the rewards and deliver! All the artwork is already completed unless we reach the bigger stretch goal, which I gave myself an extra couple of weeks to complete if we do reach it.

I'll likely be working with my main printing company that I've used for my last 2 books, and there haven't been any problems in the past. I've also selected suppliers for the rest of the rewards already.

If any hiccups come along, I'll be sure to update right away.

The biggest challenge I have had with my Kickstarter campaigns is the time for rewards. If this project is funded like my last MAKE 100 I will email everyone with adjusted timelines. I have set the reward dates back quite a bit for this Kickstarter... but the hope is to get the art to you sooner!!

The risk involved with this is weather.  If it is a cruddy weather day, people won't be on the lake.  If its amazing they will.  We plan to maximize the nice weather days.  We also plan to stick to a daily budget.  Plan for so many meals per day and once we are out we are out.  This will likely keep us from being stuck with unused inventory.

The risks with this book, is that because the emotion is so raw, I think it could offend some people. But I want people to look past that and for them to learn from Sheree’s story, from her words and the actions she took for her daughter and her whanau.

This book has definitely had it’s challenges and has been quite the labour of love. It has taken me over a year to put together. I found it tough to read the hurt and pain that my friend was going through, then having to ask her for photos and sometimes I was worried, that I might be causing the feeling for her, perhaps, reliving the pain.  
I would read parts of the blog, sit back and really be thankful for what I have, you just never know what might happen, so be thankful and know that there is love all around.

Let us trace the steps of Azalia's journey right alongside Sheree.

The film already has a TV distribution deal in place with Point du Jour International who have represented Carine and sold her films for many years. If we are successful with this Kickstarter we will be able to start the edit and get it in front of TV commissioners.

We have done our upmost to mitigate the risks and challenges involved in a project of this kind. A lot of groundwork has been done to ensure that what we present to you today is something we can deliver, and in a timely fashion too. We believe communication is key to the success of any project, and we will be maintaining regular contact with our backers throughout the process. We have already delivered one journal to great acclaim, and we aim to do the same again this time.

Whilst we hope we have seen the worst of things in 2020, we are still feeling the effects in 2021 and the most likely impact is the postal service. Delays to countries outside of the UK seem to be returning to some semblance of normalcy, and we're doing all we can to keep costs low whilst also delivering the level of service that we would expect ourselves.

Ultimately, our team is whole-heartedly committed to this project and open, honest and transparent communication will see to it that we achieve all that we set out to. Should any problems or delays occur along the way, we will be in touch.
The main risks to this fund raising will be the time to print the book. We're in the publishing process and have completed the collaborative part of the work.

The goal for the release of Dirty Girls Renewed is September 13, 2022. The biggest challenge to releasing it on time ... is time. One of the main reasons for this campaign is to raise funds to help support me while I take time to write. If the funds don't come in, I will still write Dirty Girls Renewed (that isn't changing!) but it may take longer than the projected timeframe. The good thing is I already have a strong outline prepared and have been thinking about these specific revisions for years. Writing will be the easy part of the project as long as there is time in the day to complete it. 

Another challenge is a personal one—my husband and I have been walking through infertility (which in itself isn't a cheap process) for two years. Between treatments and the waiting, it is a stressful experience. If I get pregnant sometime in the next year, that poses challenges too (though one I really want). I am ready to take on whatever God has and appreciate your support along the way.

The risks for this project are pretty low! As I've run three similar projects already I have the framework to create this project more efficiently, and once the project has been funded all that needs to be done is production, printing, and delivery!

Having worked on numerous independent films, we understand that there are risks and challenges. Luckily, the filming is wrapped and the editing is going smoothly, but we still have the hardest and most important piece to complete. We still need to reach our audience and that is where your generous support comes in. With your backing, we can secure the financing to finish the edit and get the film festival ready. 

This film can make a real impact and open up the conversation about the hardships facing working mothers, but only with your help. Please donate and spread the word!

The biggest challenge is hitting the goal deadline on Kickstarter. I am passionate about my food and I live for making people smile with my Mac & Cheese. As with everything else going on with COVID-19, the biggest risk is not being able to run my food truck due to quarantine, or health risks. What I've learned throughout this pandemic, is that the fear of the unknown is temporary, and that adaptability is key. That being said I will always pursue my dream of owning my own food truck, even if that means postponing the grand opening.

Karen Kring here: I've been conceptualizing this speakers series since May 2018. I've talked to numerous people to gain their perspective on this project--a mayor, numerous non-profit executives, community leaders and neighbors-- and have gotten much moral support. The challenges I'm currently anticipating include
- Not picking a big enough venue for the first speakers night. I'd imagined 40-50 people attending, but it could be more. To address this possible blessing, I'm doing my homework to find a venue that could seat a small number easily, but expand to accommodate more people comfortably.
- Not attracting the most diverse audience possible. This project aims to include people from all corners of Evanston, IL especially, but also neighbors beyond those city limits who would appreciate and be impacted by this conversation. I'm working on seeing that that does not by forming a host committee of neighbors from diverse backgrounds.
- Not seeing what is in my blind spot. Sometimes I think some things should happen easily, but they don't. If I'd had my way, this would have happened in fall 2018. The good news is that I'm consulting with numerous community leaders with vast experience at pulling together projects more complex than this. I'll will continue to be in touch with them as I work out various wrinkles.

This project is just about ready to be launched, and most of it is already finished. We have suppliers ready to go to order the materials and supplies needed. The only things we don't have lined up is the exact brand, weight and material of T-Shirt and T-Shirt vinyl we are going to use. However, we have many samples and will be nailing this down after a little bit more testing.

We have prototypes of all of the products, and have been beta testing all aspects of Decal production with real people. We've used an outsourced T-Shirt manufacturer for prototyping the T-Shirts, and investigated several techniques before deciding on the heat-pressed vinyl method. This method produces the highest quality result. It also happens to be the most economical for us and allows us to reuse existing equipment and processes, with only one additional piece of equipment needed.

As a web developer with years of experience, I don't foresee any issues with finishing the development of the website. I have designed it with scaling in mind and should be able to handle thousands of users easily. That said, every website has it's own unique growing pains and there may be some hitches that I will certainly address as soon as possible.

The biggest challenge, which is nice to have, is this project being overwhelmingly popular, and having a lot of interest from backers. This could cause a delay, but we will be able to forecast this easily as the campaign runs. Our campaign goal assumes a certain number of backers, and we will be able to easily handle 4-5 times that many without needing any extra help. If it ends up being too much, we have resources we can pull in to help with manufacturing and fulfillment to hopefully minimize any delay. The final products are manufactured entirely in-house, so once we get the stock of vinyl and t-shirts, we're good to go, and won't be waiting on any third parties to fulfill orders.

THANK YOU for your support!

Dans un contexte de perte de crédibilité de l'information et de "bruit médiatique", notre défi consiste à construire un modèle économique sur le web qui repose sur la force d'un contenu presse qui assure des informations sourcées et des conseils de professionnels.

Depuis décembre, nous relevons chaque semaine ce défi par un filtrage de l’actualité avec une proposition éditoriale qui a déjà trouvé un public :  

- en assumant une rigueur de l’information...
- en donnant du sens aux lecteurs en quête d’authenticité, par des clés de compréhension et de sélections assumées. 

Comment allons-nous assurer notre réussite ?

1.	en améliorant la plateforme technique dans la continuité des services offerts à la communauté Singular’s : 
-	après une version 1.0, une plateforme 2.0 mise en ligne le 15 mai 2018 apporte de nouvelles fonctionnalités pour valoriser le contenu éditorial : tri par thème et par contributeur, outil de recherche, commentaires, mise en avant des marques,
-	d’autres versions sont planifiées pour dynamiser encore l’ergonomie du site et améliorer le confort de lecture,…
 
2.	en fidélisant les adhérents de la communauté Singular’s
-	par la découverte de savoir-faire d’artisans (d’art, de luxe, de stylistes, viticulteurs, restaurateurs, producteurs de produits gastronomiques, artistes, photographes etc.),
-	par la mise en relation physique, en organisant des afterworks, du showrooming et des événementiels exclusifs mêlant artisanat, contenu éditorial et gastronomie.

Nous croyons au modèle économique que nous mettrons en oeuvre :

a/ sous forme d’abonnement payant de la partie « informations pratiques » du Webzine Singular’s, avec un prix moyen de 22€ par mois, soit 264 €/an pour 44 numéros (ou 1€ l'article),

b/ en développant un Salon/Forum grand public dédié aux artisans d’art.

c/ en proposant à nos lecteurs des événements (afterworks de dégustations/conférences, showrooming) avec des invitations entre 49€ et 1 500€,

d/ en proposant des partenariats aux annonceurs autour d’événements et d’animations sur mesure (entre 3 000€ à 15 000€).

Au terme d'un peu plus de 6 mois de présence éditoriale sur le net le webzine Singular's (www.singulars.fr) a déjà conquis un lectorat fidèle de plusieurs milliers de particuliers et de professionnels. 
Plusieurs événements sont en projet, dont un associant une grande marque de luxe.

Comment nous aider et contribuer à notre réussite ?

Singular's a besoins de réunir 17 000 € pour :
-	Garantir la diffusion de son contenu éditorial pendant 1 an et atteindre le point de rentabilité, en développant de nouvelles fonctionnalités éditoriales sur sa plateforme,
-	Concevoir et lancer son Salon/Forum à Paris : location de la salle, design du lieu et des outils de communication (affiche, plan, invitations…)

The challenges of completing this project include having to compete with major sports media distributors like Bleacher Report and ESPN.  SportsAsToldByAGirl, however, is more than just another media outlet.  This project is to help one woman change the landscape of the media world for many other women.  According to the 2012 Associated Press Sports Editors Racial and Gender Report Card, women only represented 9.6% of all sports editors.  (Morrison 2014) 

This project already has an established following that can help regulate these numbers.  Currently, SportsAsToldByAGirl has thousands of followers across multiple social media platforms.  This was created with just hard work, good quality and effort.  

With your help, we can increase those numbers by putting more money into our monthly marketing budget.  We can reach new readers who are looking for a fresh perspective instead of the same established analysts constantly being pushed by television giants like ESPN and Fox Sports.

As Melinda Gates said, “Women speaking up for themselves and for those around them is the strongest force we have to change the world.”

While the operating basics for SportsAsToldByAGirl are currently low, we are hoping to expand to more than just a website.  We have already begun creating merchandise that we are hoping to make available to the public.  Currently, we would only be able to produce one garment at a time which is a very time-consuming and expensive practice.  With your help, we are hoping to be able to mass produce clothing items that we can ship to all of our readers around the world. We are looking to create multiple items and eventually have a full online store that includes everything you need for game day including team color hats and tops, sweat pants for those cold game day temperatures and of course drink holders.

All of our writers are open to helping promote the cause.  If you are interested in helping to promote SportsAsToldByAGirl, we are open to interviews and/or appearances.  Send all media requests to editor@sportsastoldbyagirl.com!

Follow us:

Twitter: @sportsastold
Instagram: @sportsastoldbyagirl

$6,000 is our break even point. We don’t make a penny off of this. We have already spent well over our $6,000 budget from our own band pocket on the money at the studio, mastering, merchandise, physical product, shipping, as well as the new music video. Our biggest risk is any delays from the manufacturer on physical products.

Risks and Challenges

Over the years AlovesB has learned lessons and is ready to apply them to fulfill every order. To make sure that quality products are manufactured in a timely manner we have selected only products that we have capacity to make. We are partnering with organizations who will provide technical assistance to cooperatives where needed. All raw materials are attained in South Africa and widely available. Participating cooperatives are housed in secure work spaces to ensure that raw materials are safe across the value chain. 

As with any cross border enterprise shipping the products can spring up unwanted delays. However, the size and weight of the Black History Kits and other rewards are easily shipped via air from Johannesburg to New Orleans. From Napoleonville, Louisiana orders will be packaged and mailed to you.

We look forward to reaching and exceeding all expectations. AlovesB is thankful for your support.
